III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Prior to the issuance of this license, all of the Lutheran Adoption Services (LAS)
offices across Michigan’s Lower Peninsula were under one license. The agency
decided to split the adoption services up into two separate licenses. The original
license will continue to cover the east side of the state and the new license will cover
the west side of the state including Lansing, Grand Rapids, and Kalamazoo.
Currently LAS has an office located in Lansing; this will be the facility location for this
license. The office they are located in is a new building that the agency moved into
within the last year. All the adoption workers who work out of the Lansing office will
work out of this location. The offices have sufficient space and resources to provide
the services for which they are licensed. Other offices include one in Grand Rapids
and one in Kalamazoo that adoption staff work out of.
B. Program Description
Lutheran Adoption Service (LAS), is a jointly owned subsidiary of Wellspring
Lutheran Services and Lutheran Social Services of Michigan. LAS is licensed to
place and supervise children in adoptive placements and recruit and assess families
for adoption. LAS also provides adoptive families with Pre and post adoption
resources to ensure children receive the services and resources they need. LAS
serves counties throughout the entire State of Michigan, exclusive of the Upper
2

Peninsula. The agency does not collect fees when a family adopts a child from the
foster care system and does not discriminate against adoption applicants because of
race, sexual orientation or religious background.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing statues and rules as well as
DHS Adoption policy and the MSA.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend Lutheran Adoption Services in Lansing be issued an original six-
month provisional license.
08/13/2014
